Field Label: Please fill the following questions at the time (baseline or subsequent visit) a patient is diagnosed with HIV.
FIGO Staging (2009) at the time of Diagnosis
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, I       - The carcinoma is strictly conﬁned to the cervix (extension to the corpus would be disregarded). | 2, IA     -  Invasive carcinoma which can be diagnosed only by microscopy, with deepest invasion ≤5 mm and largest extension ≥7 mm. | 3, IA1   - Measured stromal invasion of ≤3.0 mm in depth and extension of ≤7.0 mm. | 4, IA2   - Measured stromal invasion of >3.0 mm and not >5.0 mm with an extension of not >7.0 mm. | 5, IB     - Clinically visible lesions limited to the cervix uteri or pre-clinical cancers greater than stage IA * | 6, IB1   - Clinically visible lesion ≤4.0 cm in greatest dimension. | 7, IB2   - Clinically visible lesion >4.0 cm in greatest dimension. | 8, II      - Cervical carcinoma invades beyond the uterus, but not to the pelvic wall or to the lower third of the vagina. | 9, IIA    - Without parametrial invasion. | 10, IIA1 - Clinically visible lesion ≤4.0 cm in greatest dimension. | 11, IIA2 - Clinically visible lesion >4 cm in greatest dimension. | 12, IIB   - With obvious parametrial invasion. | 13, III    - The tumor extends to the pelvic wall and/or involves lower third of the vagina and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney ** | 14, IIIA  - Tumor involves lower third of the vagina, with no extension to the pelvic wall. | 15, IIIB  - Extension to the pelvic wall and/or hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney. | 16, IV    - The carcinoma has extended beyond the true pelvis or has involved (biopsy proven) the mucosa of the bladder or rectum. A bullous edema, as such, does not permit a case to be allotted to Stage IV. | 17, IVA  - Spread of the growth to adjacent organs. | 18, IVB  - Spread to distant organs.

Field Label: FIGO Staging (2018) at the time of Diagnosis
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, I       - The carcinoma is strictly conﬁned to the cervix (extension to the uterine corpus should be disregarded). | 2, IA     - Invasive carcinoma that can be diagnosed only by microscopy, with maximum depth of invasion <5 mm2 | 3, IA1   - Measured stromal invasion <3 mm in depth. | 4, IA2   - Measured stromal invasion ≥3 mm and <5 mm in depth. | 5, IB     - Invasive carcinoma with measured deepest invasion ≥5 mm (greater than Stage IA), lesion limited to the cervix uteri. | 6, IB1   - Invasive carcinoma ≥5 mm depth of stromal invasion, and <2 cm in greatest dimension. | 7, IB2   - Invasive carcinoma ≥2 cm and <4 cm in greatest dimension. | 8, IB3   - Invasive carcinoma ≥4 cm in greatest dimension. | 9, II      - The carcinoma invades beyond the uterus, but has not extended onto the lower third of the vagina or to the pelvic wall. | 10, IIA    - Involvement limited to the upper two- thirds of the vagina without parametrial involvement. | 11, IIA1 - Invasive carcinoma <4 cm in greatest dimension. | 12, IIA2 - Invasive carcinoma ≥4 cm in greatest dimension. | 13, IIB   - With parametrial involvement but not up to the pelvic wall. | 14, III    - The carcinoma involves the lower third of the vagina and/or extends to the pelvic wall and/or causes hydronephrosis or nonfunction-ing kidney and/or involves pelvic and/or para- aortic lymph nodes. | 15, IIIA  - The carcinoma involves the lower third of the vagina, with no extension to the pelvic wall. | 16, IIIB  - Extension to the pelvic wall and/or hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney (unless known to be due to another cause). | 17, IIIC  - Involvement of pelvic and/or para- aortic lymph nodes, irrespective of tumor size and extent (with r and p notations). | 18, IIIC1  - Pelvic lymph node metastasis only. | 19, IIIC2  - Para- aortic lymph node metastasis. | 20, IV    - The carcinoma has extended beyond the true pelvis or has involved (biopsy proven) the mucosa of the bladder or rectum. (A bullous edema, as such, does not permit a case to be allotted to Stage IV). | 21, IVA  - Spread to adjacent pelvic organs. | 22, IVB  - Spread to distant organs.

0, T0 - No evidence of Tumor | 1, T1 | 2, T1a | 3, T1a1 | 4, T1a2 | 5, T1b | 6, T1b2 | 7, T2 | 8, T2a | 9, T2a1 | 10, T2a2 | 11, T2b | 12, T3 | 13, T3a | 14, T3b | 15, T4 | 16, Any T | 17, TX - Primary Tumor cannot be assessed
0, N0 - No regional lymph node metastasis | 1, N1 - Regional lymph node metastasis | 2, NX - Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
0, M0 - No distant metastasis | 1, M1 - Distant metastasis | 2, MX - Distant metastasis cannot be assessed
